In conclusion, the current U.S. government position on the border is one that advocates for a strict, comprehensive approach that includes border controls. The current system is not perfect, and it is crucial that the government adopts more stringent measures to ensure its citizens are safe at the border.

### Response:
response: The US should abolish the Electoral College, which was created to balance the national elections in a way that would ensure the best representation of each state's voters. By abolishing the Electoral College, a single, centralized mechanism that controls the votes of the states has been eroded, resulting in the loss of the ability to choose the President and Vice President based on their own merits. This erosion of the power of the Electoral College has led to the rise of right-wing populists and anti-immigrant politicians, as well as a decline in national unity. It is time to end this power-hungry system and return to the principles of federalism and representation that have long defined American democracy.
